page.title: 13TRAFFIC SURVEY IN WOOTTON
page.content: The major road in Wootton High Street is used by both local and through traffic . Traffic movement is heaviest during the rush hours from 8 to 9 a.m. and from 5 to 6 p.m. and at lunchtime, with people commuting to jobs in nearby Ryde and Newport. Over a typical ten minute period 215 cars, 30 vans and lorries, 2 buses and a number of cycles passed our survey point in both directions. Wootton lies on the main Newport to Ryde road and 3 bus services, 1A,1B,4C pass through regularly. Wootton Bridge itself is a potentially dangerous spot, being very narrow with no pavement. The access road to the car ferry terminal has also recently been widened and improved to reduce summer congestion at this point.
